title: Add FAQ component
message_prompt: Make a new component called FAQ and add it to App.js. I want it to render a button identical to magicwand except it has a '?' and is in the bottom-left corner.
message_edit:
I will create a new component called FAQ.js which will render a button with a '?' symbol. This button will be styled similarly to the MagicWandButton but will be positioned in the bottom-left corner of the screen. Then, I will import and add this component to App.js so that it is rendered as part of the application.

Steps:
1. Create a new file called FAQ.js with a new component that renders a button with a '?' symbol.
2. Position the button in the bottom-left corner of the screen.
3. Import and add the FAQ component to App.js.
diff_edit:
diff --git a/frontend/src/App.js b/frontend/src/App.js
index 208d408..41bbe45 100644
--- a/frontend/src/App.js
+++ b/frontend/src/App.js
@@ -7,2 +7,3 @@ import Dot from './Dot';
 import Camera from './Camera';
+import FAQButton from './navigation/FAQ';
 import LoadingHandler from './LoadingHandler';
@@ -181,2 +182,3 @@ const App = () => {
             </Canvas>
+            <FAQButton />
         </>
diff --git a/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js b/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..0652fb9
--- /dev/null
+++ b/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+const FAQButton = () => (
+    <button
+        style={{
+            fontSize: '16px',
+            borderRadius: '4px',
+            border: '1px solid #ccc',
+            backgroundColor: 'black',
+            color: 'white',
+            height: '50px',
+            width: '50px',
+            position: 'fixed',
+            bottom: '10px',
+            left: '10px',
+            cursor: 'pointer',
+        }}
+        title="Frequently Asked Questions"
+    >
+        ?
+    </button>
+);
+
+export default FAQButton;
